WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES E-SIGN DISCLOSURE AND AGREEMENT

 

Effective February 7, 2023

Version 4.0

Please take this opportunity to review the following disclosures and information about accessing and using the Whataburger Online Services, including the Whataburger Mobile App. If you are under the age of 13, you are not allowed to open a MyWhataburger Account or use the Whataburger Mobile App and the Whataburger Online Services.

 

E-SIGN Disclosure and Agreement for the Whataburger Online Services

 

As part of your relationship with us, we want to ensure you have all of the information you need to effectively manage your MyWhataburger Account (as that term is defined in the Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions below). We are required by law to give you certain information “in writing,” which means you are entitled to receive it on paper. We may, however, provide some of this information to you electronically, instead, with your prior consent. This E-SIGN Disclosure and Agreement for the Whataburger Online Services (“E-SIGN Agreement”) describes how Whataburger communicates with you electronically, provides additional detail about the Electronic Communications (as that term is defined below) that we provide you, and sets out hardware and software requirements you need to receive these Electronic Communications. Please review this E-SIGN Agreement as it applies to Electronic Communications and will be effective until expressly withdrawn by you.

 

Applicability of Consent

 

This E-SIGN Agreement applies to your use of any Whataburger Website, mobile application, and online service or program (“Whataburger Online Services”).

 

Electronic Communications

 

You agree and consent to receive electronically all communications, agreements, documents, notices and disclosures (collectively, “Electronic Communications”) that we provide in connection with the Whataburger Online Services. Electronic Communications include, but are not limited to: (a) agreements and policies you agree to (e.g., the Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions and the Whataburger Privacy Policy), including updates to these documents. (b) transaction summaries, confirmations or other information. (c) MyWhataburger Account history. (d) customer service communications. and (e) promotions, offers, or coupons. We may provide these Electronic Communications to you by posting them on the Whataburger Website(s), by emailing them to you at the primary email address listed in your MyWhataburger Account, or by making them accessible in your Whataburger Mobile App. Electronic Communications will be provided online and viewable using in-app display features, browser software or .pdf files. In such cases, you will be able to print the Electronic Communication and/or have it emailed to you.

 

Receipt of Electronic Communications. Contact Information

 

Electronic Communications will be deemed received by you within 24 hours of when such Electronic Communication is posted or sent to you. You agree that if Whataburger sends you an Electronic Communication, but you do not receive it because your primary email address on file is incorrect, out of date, blocked by your service provider, or you are otherwise unable to receive Electronic Communications, Whataburger will be deemed to have provided the Electronic Communication to you. You may not be able to transact using your MyWhataburger Account until we receive a valid, working primary email address from you. If you use a spam filter or similar software that blocks or re-routes emails from senders not listed in your email address book, we recommend that you add Whataburger to your email address book so that you can receive Electronic Communications by email.

 

Required Hardware and Software

 

You are responsible for maintaining all software and hardware necessary for receiving, viewing and maintaining record of the Electronic Communications. By accepting this Agreement, you represent that you will maintain all hardware and software necessary to receive, view and maintain (including, but not limited to saving and/or printing) any Electronic Communications provided to you. You must have: (a) a valid email address on file with Whataburger. (b) a computer, mobile device, tablet or similar device with internet access and current browser software and computer software that is capable of receiving, accessing, displaying, and either printing or storing Electronic Communications received from us. (c) and sufficient storage space to save Electronic Communications (whether presented online, within the Whataburger Mobile App, in emails or .pdf) or the ability to print Electronic Communications. We will notify you if there are any material changes to the hardware or software needed to receive Electronic Communications from us. By giving your consent you confirm that you have access to the necessary equipment and are able to receive, open, and print or download a copy of any Electronic Communications for your records. You may print or save a copy of these Electronic Communications for your records as they may not be accessible online at a later date.

 

You are responsible for the installation, maintenance, and operation of your computer or electronic device. We are not responsible for any errors or failures from any malfunction of your computer or electronic device, for any virus, other problems or changes that may be associated with the use of your computer or electronic device, including, for example, the cost of your Internet service provider.

 

Additional Copies

 

Additional copies of any Electronic Communication may be provided to you without charge by contacting Whataburger within 90 days of the original date of the communication. You may also request paper copies of any electronic communication within 90 days of the communication by contacting Whataburger at the address provided below in Section 18.1 of the Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions. Whataburger reserves the right to assess a reasonable fee for providing such paper copies.

 

Withdrawal of Electronic Acceptance of Disclosures and Notices

 

You may withdraw your consent to receive Electronic Communications by contacting Whataburger at the address provided in Section 18.1 below. If you fail to provide your consent to this E-SIGN Agreement, or if you withdraw your consent to receive Electronic Communications, Whataburger reserves the right to either deny your application/registration for a MyWhataburger Account, restrict or close your MyWhataburger Account, or charge you additional fees for paper copies.

 

Federal Law. Termination and Changes

 

You acknowledge and agree that your consent to Electronic Communications is being provided in connection with a transaction affecting interstate commerce that is subject to the federal Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act (“E-SIGN Act”), and that you and we both intend that the E-SIGN Act apply to the fullest extent possible to validate our ability to conduct business with you by electronic means. We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to discontinue the provision of your Electronic Communications, or to terminate or change the terms and conditions on which we provide Electronic Communications. We will provide you with notice of any such termination or change as required by law.

 

Consent

 

By providing your consent, you are also confirming that you have the hardware and software described above, that you are able to receive and review electronic records, and that you have an active email address for use. This consent applies to your use of the Whataburger Mobile App and Whataburger Website(s).

 

Agree or Decline

 

If you either (i) use the Whataburger Online Services (either the Whataburger Website or the Mobile App), or click on the “I Agree” button in the Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions below, you are agreeing to receive disclosures electronically as stated in this E-SIGN Agreement and you are agreeing to the following Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions.

 

If you DO NOT want to consent to electronic delivery of disclosures,

 

PLEASE EXIT THE WHATABURGER WEBSITE OR MOBILE APP NOW.

 

If you either (i) use the Whataburger Online Services (either the Whataburger Website or the Mobile App), or (ii) click on the “I Agree” button in the Whataburger Website or Mobile App, such actions evidence your consent to electronic delivery of disclosures and the following Whataburger Online Services Terms and Conditions.


 

 

WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

Effective February 7, 2023

Version 4.0

 

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES TERMS AND CONDITIONS (THESE “TERMS”) CAREFULLY. THEY GOVERN YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF ANY WHATABURGER WEBSITE, MOBILE APPLICATION, AND ONLINE SERVICE OR PROGRAM (“WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES”). DOWNLOADING, INSTALLING, ACCESSING, OR USING THE WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES CONSTITUTES ACCEPTANCE OF THESE TERMS, AS THEY MAY BE AMENDED FROM TIME TO TIME. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS, YOU SHOULD NOT USE OR ACCESS THE WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES.

 

THESE TERMS ARE BETWEEN YOU AND WHATABURGER. IF YOU OPEN A MYWHATABURGER ACCOUNT OR DOWNLOAD THE WHATABURGER MOBILE APP AND YOU DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM AGE REQUIREMENT, WHATABURGER IS NOT LIABLE FOR ANY OF YOUR SUBSEQUENT PURCHASES OR ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PURCHASE TRANSACTIONS.

 

BY ACCEPTING THESE TERMS, YOU AGREE TO RESOLVE ANY DISPUTE WITH US ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THESE TERMS THROUGH BINDING ARBITRATION OR SMALL CLAIMS DISPUTE PROCEDURES AND YOU AGREE TO WAIVE YOUR RIGHTS TO PARTICIPATE IN A CLASS ACTION SUIT. 

IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS, DO NOT ACCESS THE WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES. OTHERWISE, YOUR ACCESS OF THE WHATABURGER ONLINE SERVICES AND YOUR AGREEMENT TO THESE TERMS MEANS YOU HAVE ACCEPTED ALL OF THESE TERMS.

 

1. What These Terms Cover. These Terms are entered into between you and Whatabrands LLC and its affiliates and subsidiaries (collectively, “Whataburger,” which may be referred to as “we,” “us,” or “our”) and govern your access to and use of the Whataburger Online Services, which includes the programs, offers, content, information services, features and any Whataburger hosted games or challenges and made available through any Whataburger website, including, but not limited to whataburger.com, stories.whataburger.com, shop.whataburger.com, locations.whataburger.com, whataburger.avature.net, whataburger.taleo.net, whataburgervisit.com, whataburgerfeedback.com, whatastore.com, and whataburger.app.link (collectively, the “Whataburger Websites”) and the Whataburger mobile application (the “Whataburger Mobile App” or “Mobile App”). The terms “User” and “you” refer to you. You must accept these Terms before you can use the Whataburger Online Services. These Terms will be available for you to view at all times on the Whataburger Website at www.whataburger.com. Whataburger may amend these Terms at any time in accordance with Section 12 of the Terms. As between you and Whataburger, Whataburger is solely responsible for the Whataburger Online Services. Neither Apple, Inc. (Apple Store), Google, Inc. (Google Play for Android), nor any other app store or marketplace is responsible for the Whataburger Mobile App or any of its contents.

 

2. Services.

 

2.1 Description of the Online Services. Whataburger, through the Online Services, allows you to use most computers, tablets, or mobile devices to complete various functions related to: registering for and creating a MyWhataburger Account. loading of funds to your Whataburger Virtual Gift Card account (defined in Section 4.6) linked to your MyWhataburger Account. conducting mobile payment transactions using the Mobile App at participating Whataburger locations. and participating in the Whataburger Rewards Program (discussed further below). You can establish a MyWhataburger account (the “MyWhataburger Account”) and load/reload funds to your Whataburger Virtual Gift Card linked to the MyWhataburger Account using the valid payment method of your choice accepted by Whataburger. Whataburger, through the Online Services, also provides additional optional services, such as those related to the Whataburger Rewards Program, and allows you to participate in and/or receive certain promotional materials, offers, and coupons from Whataburger. The payment and optional services (collectively the “Services”) are described in further detail in these Terms, and may be amended by Whataburger in its sole discretion from time to time. Whataburger requests that for your safety, do not use the Online Services or Mobile App while driving.

 

2.2 Nutrition Disclaimer. The Whataburger Online Services may provide nutrition information. Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000-calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. Nutrient contributions from individual components may not equal the total due to federal rounding regulations. Weight for standard product is expressed as an approximate weight after cooking or “as served.” Beverage serving size reflects the amount of liquid in the beverage cup.

 

Nutrition formulations and ingredient information is based on standard product formulations obtained by our suppliers and/or third party laboratory analysis. Variations in nutritional content may occur due to changes in seasons, differences in suppliers, recipe revisions and product assembly at the restaurants. Changes to our ingredients may occur without notice, and may in turn result in changes to nutritional statements. The Whataburger Websites and Mobile App contain a feature for you to choose “lower calorie” options based upon food preparation methods, item ingredient selections, and side item selections for Whataburger meals. The “lower calorie” options do not include sauces, salad dressings, custom orders or additional condiments that you may consume. The information disclosed in ingredient statements may not identify all ingredients and may use comprehensive terms that may not sufficiently inform a person of the presence of a foodstuff that may produce an allergic reaction. Federal law has identified the eight major food allergens as: eggs, fish, milk, peanuts, shellfish, soy, tree nuts and wheat. For your convenience, menu items which contain these major allergens are identified by a corresponding allergen icon on our online menu at www.whataburger.com. Gluten and MSG are two other common sensitivities which are disclosed on our menu. While a particular menu item may not feature one of these allergens, our products may be prepared using equipment that is shared with products containing one or more of these allergens and it is possible for your menu item to come into contact with an allergen. Whataburger, its franchisees and their respective employees do not assume liability for a particular allergy or sensitivity to any food provided in our restaurants. No menu item is certified as gluten-free, vegetarian or vegan. We encourage any individual with food allergies or sensitivities to consult their physician before choosing which Whataburger menu item fits their needs. For most up to date information, please visit www.whataburger.com or call 1-800-6-BURGER. A representative from Whataburger will gladly help answer any questions you may have.

 

2.3 Career Opportunities. The potential employment positions listed on the Whataburger Websites include opportunities with restaurant locations owned and operated by Whataburger (“Company Stores”) as well as restaurant locations owned and operated by Whataburger franchisees (“Franchise Stores”). The positions in Whataburger’s Company Stores may be subject to different terms and conditions, including, but not limited to, benefits and employment policies, than those positions in Franchise Stores. Whataburger does not control, direct or influence the terms and conditions of employment with Franchise Stores. Likewise, Whataburger accepts no responsibility or liability with respect to the terms and conditions of employment with Franchise Stores.

 

Specific information about the terms and conditions of employment associated with a particular position will be set forth upon hire. Postings on Whataburger Websites do not represent an offer of employment. Any offer of employment must be made in writing by an authorized representative of Whataburger or of a Whataburger franchisee in accordance with Whataburger’s or the Whataburger franchisee’s hiring policies and procedures. Nothing contained on any Whataburger Website alters the employment at will relationship between Whataburger or a Whataburger franchisee and its respective employees.

 

3. Eligibility To Use Whataburger Online Services.

 

3.1 User Representations. By entering into these Terms you represent that:

 

(a) You are at least 13 years of age and have the right, power and authority to enter into these Terms. If you are between the ages of 13 and 18, you may only download the Mobile App, complete the MyWhataburger Account set-up process, and use the Whataburger Online Services under the supervision or direction of a parent or legal guardian who agrees to be bound by these Terms. If you are under the age of 13, you are not allowed to open a MyWhataburger Account or use the Mobile App and the Online Services.

 

(b) You are not located in a country that is subject to U.S. government embargo, or that has been designated by the U.S. government as a “terrorist supporting” country, and that you are not listed on any U.S. government list of prohibited or restricted parties.

 

(c) You agree to only create one MyWhataburger Account for yourself.

 

(d) All information provided by you to Whataburger is correct and current, and you will update your MyWhataburger Account information with Whataburger as soon as it changes.

 

(e) You will maintain the security of your MyWhataburger Account by not sharing your Login Credentials (including password, PIN or any other method used to log in) with others and restricting access to your MyWhataburger Account and your computer, tablet, and mobile device.

 

(f) You and the transactions you enter into using your MyWhataburger Account and Whataburger Online Services comply, and will continue to comply, with applicable laws and regulations.

 

(g) You will not use the Whataburger Online Services in connection with any fraudulent or illegal activity or in any manner which interferes with the operation of the Whataburger Online Services.

 

(h) You will use the Whataburger Online Services only in compliance with these Terms.

 

(i) The account with your mobile service provider that you use for the mobile device, and the account with your internet service provider that you use for online access, is current and in good standing.

 

(j) You will not use the Whataburger Online Services outside of the United States or for any transaction requiring payment in foreign currency.

 

(k) If you are a business entity, you are authorized to do business in the jurisdictions in which you operate, and your employees are authorized to use the Whataburger Online Services to bind you to these Terms and all transactions conducted with your user name and Login Credentials.

 

(l) You will promptly notify us if you discover or otherwise suspect any security breach or security compromise relating to your use of the Whataburger Websites Online Services.

 

(m) You will take responsibility for all activities that occur under your MyWhataburger Account and accept all risk of unauthorized access.

 

3.2 Device Identification Metrics. When the Whataburger Online Services are utilized through the Whataburger Website(s) or Mobile App, we may obtain and maintain certain electronic identification or log data that is automatically provided by your device including, but not limited to, the unique device identifier or mobile equipment identifier for your mobile device, Internet Protocol (IP) address, computer/mobile device operating system and browser type, type of mobile device, cookie data, cache data, and latitude and longitude of the device, if geo-location functionality has been enabled on your device (collectively, the “Device Identification Metrics”). This information is necessary to process your transactions and deliver the Whataburger Online Services and as part of our ongoing efforts to detect and deter unauthorized or fraudulent use of, or abuse of, the Whataburger Online Services, including MyWhataburger Accounts. If you take steps to modify or disable security settings or controls provided in the operating system of your mobile device, such as “jailbreaking” or “rooting” the device, Whataburger may block your device and terminate your MyWhataburger Account under Section 4.9 below

 

4. MyWhataburger Account Registration.

 

4.1 Your MyWhataburger Account. In order to obtain all of the Whataburger Online Services, you must create a MyWhataburger Account. In order to use the payment function of the Mobile App at participating Whataburger locations, you must register at least one valid payment method as described in Section 4.5 below (each a “Payment Method”) in order to load/reload funds to your Whataburger Virtual Gift Card account (defined in Section 4.6 below) linked to your MyWhataburger Account and use the Mobile App for purchases. By registering a Payment Method with your MyWhataburger Account that is a either a credit, debit, or stored value account, or a third party mobile wallet account (such as Apple Pay®, PayPal® or Google Pay™) you authorize Whataburger to take appropriate steps to validate your Payment Method account. You will not be required to pay for any of the Whataburger Payment Method account verification process.

 

4.2 MyWhataburger Account Creation. Payment Method Account Information. Accuracy of MyWhataburger Account Information. Responsibility for Payment Method Account Activity. Load and Reload of Funds to Your MyWhataburger Account. You understand that to create your MyWhataburger Account, you will be asked to provide your name and certain other personal information, which may include, but may not be limited to, first and last name, address, zip code, valid email address, and telephone number. You may also use an existing third-party account, such as your Facebook, Google or Apple account, to create your MyWhataburger Account if the MyWhataburger Account creation process supports such third-party account. If you use an existing third-party account to create your MyWhataburger Account, then Whataburger will receive your public profile information (which may include your first and last name, email address, profile page information, gender and date of birth), and, if your existing third-party account has a profile picture associated with it, then your current profile picture will also be included in your MyWhataburger Account. In addition, if you use an existing third-party account to create your MyWhataburger Account, then you will not be able to unlink that third-party account from your MyWhataburger Account. If you use an existing third-party account to create your MyWhataburger Account, then you may be asked to provide additional information including, but not limited to, your email address, physical address, zip code and telephone number.

 

You will have the capability to load more than one Payment Method account for loading/reloading of funds for use in your MyWhataburger Account. You understand that to add a Payment Method to your MyWhataburger Account, you will be asked to provide certain information, which may include, but may not be limited to, first and last name, billing address, zip code, CVV and expiration date. Whataburger reserves the right, at any time and in its sole discretion, to limit the number of Payment Methods that may be associated with a MyWhataburger Account. The Whataburger Mobile App also contains the ability to scan your Payment Method that is a credit card or debit card as part of the Payment Method account provisioning process. In order to use this function, Whataburger and its Third-Party Providers (defined below) will need access to your “Camera” function on your mobile device. However, the image of the Payment Method credit card or debit card will not be stored in the “Photos” section of your mobile device, nor will the image be stored by Whataburger or its Third-Party Providers.

 

If you only have one Payment Method account, then the default Payment Method account for loading/reloading funds will be that Payment Method account. If you have more than one Payment Method account, then the default Payment Method account for loading/reloading funds will be the first Payment Method account you enter, unless you change the default Payment Method account within your MyWhataburger Account.

 

If you include a Payment Method account that is a separate third-party mobile wallet, such as Apple Pay®, PayPal® or Google Pay™, then you understand loading/reloading of funds using those third-party mobile wallets is governed by the separate terms and conditions of that particular mobile wallet, including management of separate payment accounts loaded into those mobile wallets. For example, using Apple Pay® with the Touch ID® function to pay is governed by the separate Apple Pay® terms and conditions, and not these Terms.

 

When you initiate an initial load to your Whataburger Virtual Gift Card account linked to your MyWhataburger Account, we will send you an email confirming the load transaction and immediately bill your Payment Method account for the transaction amount you have selected. The initial load transaction will appear on your Payment Method account statement as “Whataburger Digital Sale” or “Whataburger Mobile Sale.”

 

Whataburger will impose limits, in its sole discretion, on the number of loads/reloads per day and the amount of funds that you may load/reload into your Whataburger Virtual Gift Card account linked to your MyWhataburger Account. You may also use the MyWhataburger Account automatic reload function by setting the default Payment Method account for automatic reloads, and setting either the reload data or the MyWhataburger Account balance amount that will trigger an automatic funds reload transaction. We will send you an email notifying you when the automatic reload function has been turned on. We will also send you an email confirming each automatic reload transaction and bill your Payment Method account according to the reload schedule and reload transaction amount you have selected. We will send you an email confirmation after each reload transaction to let you know your MyWhataburger Account has been reloaded. Each reload transaction will appear on your Payment Method account statement as “Whataburger Digital Sale” or “Whataburger Mobile Sale.” You can change your automatic reload preferences or de-activate the automatic reload feature at any time. To stop the automatic reload feature, you must log into your MyWhataburger Account and turn off the automatic reload feature. We will send you an email notifying you when the automatic reload function has been turned off. Your selection of the automatic reload function constitutes your ongoing authorization for recurring transactions using your Payment Method selected for automatic reload until you stop such automatic reload feature. Once the dollar value is loaded to your MyWhataburger Account, the transaction cannot be reversed.

 

You certify that all information you provide, including Payment Method account information, is accurate and complete. You agree to keep your information current by updating it as needed in your MyWhataburger Account or any other account you maintain with Whataburger. You cannot update the email address associated with your MyWhataburger Account on the Whataburger Websites or in the Mobile App. If you need to update the email address listed in your MyWhataburger Account, you must contact Whataburger Customer Care in one of the following ways:

 

Online: whataburger.com/contact-us

 

Telephone: 1-800-6-BURGER

 

Physical mail: Whataburger

300 Concord Plaza Dr.

San Antonio, TX 78216

ATTN: Whataburger Customer Care

 

Whataburger reserves the right to suspend or terminate your MyWhataburger Account, in Whataburger’s sole discretion, in the event you provide inaccurate, false, or incomplete information, or fail to comply with the MyWhataburger Account registration requirements.

 

4.3 Privacy Policy and Additional Mobile App Information Terms. The information you provide to Whataburger, including your personal information, is subject to the terms of Whataburger’s Privacy Policy, which is available at whataburger.com/home/privacypolicy. Our Privacy Policy applies to (a) personal information collected from or provided by you through the Whataburger Online Services, and (b) for Whataburger Online Gift Card Recipients, personal information collected from or provided about you by the purchaser and sender of your Whataburger Online Gift Card (see Section 4.6 below). We do not respond to web browser “do not track” signals at this time. We await the result of work by the policy community and industry to determine when such a response is appropriate and what form it should take. If you use certain functions within the Mobile App that rely on geo-location functionality, please be advised that Whataburger or its Third-Party Providers may monitor and track your mobile device’s geo-location in order to deliver such functionality. For example, if you use the “Locations” function and want to find the Whataburger location nearest to your current location, Whataburger and its Third-Party Providers will monitor your geo-location to deliver that information to you. Please also note that some functionality within the Whataburger Websites or Mobile App may not be available or may not fully function if you turn off geo-location services. For example, without geo-location services turned on, Whataburger will not be able to determine the closest Whataburger location to you.

 

Whataburger may make personalized marketing messages, ads or offers to you through any medium, including social media, based upon: (a) your interaction with the Mobile App, our Websites, content, or Whataburger Online Services. (b) information from activities such as your purchase and transaction history, including information about you gathered through Whataburger Rewards. and (c) notifications, ads, offers or new Whataburger location announcements or Whataburger events based upon geo-location data collected from your mobile device through the Mobile App. Such information allows us to provide you with more useful and relevant notifications, ads, offers or announcements. We do not sell your personal information to unaffiliated third parties, but we do provide information to third parties, including the Third-Party Providers, for the delivery of Whataburger notifications, ads, offers or announcements. Also, some third parties may provide us information about you from offline and online sources that we may use to provide you more relevant and useful notifications, ads, offers or announcements.

 

For Whataburger Online Gift Card Recipients, you understand that Whataburger will send you the Online Gift Card notification email, as well as additional emails or Mobile App communications: (i) reminding you to use your Online Gift Card funds. (ii) containing Online Gift Card balance updates. (iii) asking you about your Online Gift Card and Whataburger experience. and (iv) marketing messages, ads or offers

 

You can opt out from receiving personalized marketing messages, ads and offers. However, the opt-out will apply only to the specific channel, browser or device from which you opt out. You will need to opt out separately from each channel (e.g., email, push notifications) and on all of your browsers and devices. Note that some Third-Party Providers may also make their own opt-out process available. Please note that for some channels, even if you choose to opt-out of receiving targeted advertising, you may still receive advertising about Whataburger – it just will not be tailored to your interests.

 

4.4 Login Credentials.

 

(a) Upon creating your MyWhataburger Account, you must establish a username and password (your “MyWhataburger Account Login Credentials”). If you create your MyWhataburger Account using an existing third-party account, such as a Facebook, Google or Apple account, then your Login Credentials will be the username you establish for the MyWhataburger Account and your the password associated with that existing third-party account. You are solely responsible for safeguarding your MyWhataburger Account Login Credentials. You may choose to add a Whataburger Mobile App PIN at any time by visiting the “Settings” portion of the Mobile App. Whataburger also strongly encourages you to have a separate computer, tablet or mobile device authentication method, such as a password, passcode or fingerprint or facial authentication method (for example using Apple’s Touch ID® or Face ID® functions) necessary to unlock your computer, tablet or mobile device, as recommended by computer, tablet and mobile device manufacturers.

 

(b) When you use your MyWhataburger Account to make a payment transaction at a participating Whataburger location, you must enter the MyWhataburger Account Login Credential(s) required to initiate and approve such payment transaction. You are responsible for all activity that occurs under or in association with your MyWhataburger Account, including unauthorized payment transactions that result from your failure to safeguard your MyWhataburger Account Login Credential(s) required for payment transactions, or activity that occurs due to your failure to utilize either a Whataburger Mobile App PIN or computer, tablet or mobile device password or passcode.

 

(c) Please be advised that once you have logged into your MyWhataburger Account, you will remain logged in until your Login Credentials expire or you actively log out. While logged in, your MyWhataburger Account may be used to conduct all activities offered in the MyWhataburger Account, including conducting payment transactions. Whataburger strongly encourages you to use a Whataburger Mobile App PIN, mobile device passcode or fingerprint or facial authentication if available to minimize the possibility of another individual using your computer or mobile device and your MyWhataburger Account to conduct payment transactions.

 

4.5 Accepted Payment Methods. You may register and provision any valid credit, debit, or stored value account, or third-party mobile wallet account, accepted by Whataburger (each, a “Payment Method”) into your MyWhataburger Account. However, you should be aware that only certain Payment Methods are accepted by Whataburger, and you may not be able to provision some of your existing Payment Methods into your MyWhataburger Account. For a list of accepted Payment Methods visit the Whataburger Website at www.whataburger.com. Whataburger may, at any time, change or update the list of Payment Methods that you may provision to your MyWhataburger Account. Whataburger is not a bank and does not offer banking services as defined by the United States Department of Treasury and under applicable law. 6.3 Placing an Online Order. Scheduling a Pickup Time. Obtaining a Refund. You can use Online Ordering to build your order and send it to a participating Whataburger location that you select. When you build your order, you must select a pickup method, which may include take out, dine in, drive thru or delivery service. Pickup methods may vary by location. You must also select a pickup or delivery time, which may be as soon as possible or for a scheduled time. For delivery service orders, the delivery time you select will determine when your order is prepared at the designated Whataburger location. For Large Orders (as defined below) placed through the Mobile App for pickup, the pickup time you select will determine when your order is prepared at the designated Whataburger location. A “Large Order” is any order where the total cost of the order is $80 or more. For pickup orders placed through the Whataburger Website(s) or the Whataburger Mobile App that are not Large Orders, the pickup time is only an estimated time of your arrival at the designated Whataburger location. your order will not be prepared unless and until you select the “ASAP” button on the Whataburger Website(s) or in the Mobile App when you arrive at the designated Whataburger location. You may receive a notification within Online Ordering and an emailed confirmation, delivered to the email you provide us, that the restaurant has accepted your order and/or is preparing it. If you complete an Online Order on the Mobile App, you may also receive an in-app notification (if you have not disabled this function on your device) confirming your order. Each order confirmation will include information regarding your purchase, such as Menu Items ordered and amount paid. Once an “ASAP” order is placed, changes cannot be made to the order.

 

If you place a delivery order, an Online Order through the Whataburger Website(s), or your order is a Large Order placed through the Mobile App, the preparation of your order will start based on the delivery time or pickup time you select, as applicable. For pickup orders, if you arrive early to pick up an order placed through the Whataburger Website(s) or a Large Order placed through the Mobile App, you may check-in at the Online Order register, which will direct Whataburger to begin early preparation of your order. If you place an Online Order for pickup through the Whataburger Mobile App, and your order is not a Large Order, the preparation of your order will start when you select the “ASAP” button within the Mobile App when you arrive at the designated Whataburger location, regardless of the pickup time you selected. If you do not press the “ASAP” button within 24 hours of placing your Online Order for pickup through the Mobile App, your order will be cancelled. The “ASAP” button is not available on Large Orders placed through the Mobile App.

 

It is your responsibility to timely pick up all orders. If an order is not timely picked up, Whataburger may remake your food when you arrive to pick it up. This is to protect the quality of our product.

 

It is your responsibility to timely pick up all non-delivery orders. If an order is not timely picked up or initially delivered, Whataburger may remake your food when you or the delivery driver arrive to pick it up. This is to protect the quality of our product.

 

Based on your scheduled pickup time, or if you have not yet pressed the “ASAP” button, you may have an opportunity to cancel your order. However, once Whataburger starts preparing your order, you will no longer have the ability to cancel. At that point your purchase is complete, and you authorize the restaurant to process your order total, even if you do not timely pick up the order at the applicable restaurant. The restaurant’s payment service provider will process your total amount to the payment card you selected when you built the order.

 

In some locations, you may be able to place an order for delivery. To place a delivery order, you must provide a delivery address (physical address only) and phone number where you can be contacted.
